SORRY, SHIVA IS A COMIC ALLEGORY<br /><br />NOW HE GIVES HAJJAR BULL ABOUT HEAVEN, HELL AND CHITRAGUPTA..<br /><br />SORRY --THERE IS NO HEAVEN AND HELL IN HINDUISM.. WE NEVER HEARD OF CHITRAGUPTA ( AND MISSING LINK KAYASTHAS ) TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..<br /><br />IN SANATANA DHARMA HEAVEN IS THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER ( BRAHMAN THE FIELD ) WHO SHEARED OFF A SMALL BIT OF HIS BODY AND SEND YOU AS A SOUL ( BALL OF ENERGY ) AT ITS LOWEST FREQUENCY TO GAIN LIFE EXPERIENCE..<br /><br />YOU ( YOUR SOUL EVOLVED ) FROM BACTERIA, TO BIRD, TO ANIMAL TO HUMAN WITH LOW FREQUENCY SOULD TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY , SAME AS BRAHMAN --AFTER WHICH YOUR SOUL MERGED BACK WITH MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN TO SHARE LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH ITS MOTHER ..<br /><br />WHEN THE FEED BACK STOPS IN THIS CLOSED LOOP --PRALAYA ( DISSOLUTION ) HAPPENS ..<br /><br />FIRST ASTRAL LATER IS MEANT FOR ALL SPECIES OF LIVES --EXCEPT HUMAN .. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br /><br />SECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br /><br />THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br /><br />YAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br /><br />ALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br /><br />SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br /><br />ONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br /><br />THE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br /><br />WHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br /><br />YAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br /><br />YAMA USHERS IN --<br />DRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />NAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />SAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />BHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />ARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br /><br />AND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br /><br />AT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br /><br />HE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br /><br />AT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br /><br />YAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL 100 TEST TUBE KAURAVA BABIES-- HE DID IT AND HOW..<br /><br />PANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD OF MOTHER KUNTI HAS SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br /><br />Beautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_179BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole of Kerala\ncelebrates Onam, whether he is Hindu, Muslim or Christian , it does NOT matter.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We put flower carpets\nto welcome a beloved asura ruler of Kerala Mahabali in ancient days, who was\nkilled by Lord Vishnu in his Vamana ( Brahmin midget ) avatar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; Varaha (the boar- to\nkill reborn Jaya or Hiranyaksha )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>4. Narasimha (the\nhuman-lion- to kill reborn Vijaya &nbsp;or\nHiranyakashipu )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>5. Vamana (the dwarf-\nto kill asura King Mahabali whom people of Kerala started worshipping )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>6. Lord Parasurama (the\nangry man, Rama with an axe \u2013 to bring Namboodiris with Vedas inside their\nheads to Kerala , after perennial river Saraswati dried up )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>7. Lord Rama (the\nperfect man, king of Ayodha- to kill reborn Jaya/ Vijaya or Ravana and\nKumbhakarna)</b></span><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>8. Lord Krishna (the\ndivine statesman- to kill reborn Jaya /Vijaya &nbsp;or Shishupala and Dantavakra )<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Now who is Jaya and Vijaya?<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were the biggest\ndevotees of Lord Vishnu , and were his celestial demi-god gatekeepers as &nbsp;they earned Vishnu\u2019s trust and love.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Bhagavata\nPurana, &nbsp;Ravana and his brother,\nKumbhakarna were said to be reincarnations of Jaya and Vijaya, &nbsp;gatekeepers at Vaikuntha, the abode of Vishnu\nand were cursed by the Kumaras to be born in Earth for their insolence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 4 Kumaras, Sanaka,\nSanandana, Sanatana, and Sanatkumara were the manasaputras of Brahma -sons born\nfrom the mind or thought power of Brahma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several people came\ndaily to visit Lord Vishnu at Vaikunta and it was Jaya's and Vijaya's job to\nallow every person who had grievance to see the Lord. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaya and Vijaya blocked\nthe four Kuraras from entering Vaikunta, pissing them off .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They knew that Lord\nVishnu's time was precious and could not be wasted.&nbsp; The doorkeepers took their job very\nseriously. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaya suddenly realised\nwho these four children were and they were not children. &nbsp;He felt scared, very scared. ' Forgive us, you\nare the four Kumaras. &nbsp;&nbsp;You are the sons of Lord Brahma...' He said\nfaintly kneeling before the four children. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatkumar spoke, ' For\nthis we curse you... Jaya and Vijaya.&nbsp;\nYou are so full of yourselves . You think vainly that just because you\nare gate keepers , you are god \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaya and Vijaya looked\nterrified and they requested \u201c'Please do not curse us..\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Nxubc1QrnvY/UjvUtImYc0I/AAAAAAAAl-8/4TJfrTrN7Mo/s1600/020+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Nxubc1QrnvY/UjvUtImYc0I/AAAAAAAAl-8/4TJfrTrN7Mo/s640/020+(1).jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"496\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile inside\nVaikunta,&nbsp; Lord Vishnu heard the\ncommotion , rather he knew this would happen as ordained.&nbsp; He rushed out to the gate and saw his dear doorkeepers\nkneeling at the feet of the four Kumaras shaking in fear .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Vishnu heard\nSanatkumar complete his curse. '...You will no longer be gods. You will be born\non earth as ordinary humans and live like ordinary people...'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaya and Vijaya knelt\nthere stunned , unable to figure out what next. Suddenly they saw Vishnu and\nstarted explaining.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Vishnu held up his\nhand and silenced them, 'I know.. no explanations are necessary...' Lord Vishnu\nwas touched... He felt proud of them. He said 'I cannot take back the curse,\nbut I can give you a clear choice...' ( Vishnu knew what the answer would be )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He said 'Either you can\ntake seven births on earth as my devotees.....or take three births as my\nenemies...'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaya and Vijaya both\nlooked at each other . &nbsp;Seven births was\ntoo long .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As one they said, 'We\nwill be born three times as your enemy and come back to you my Lord...'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Vishnu laughed, \u201c\nI will incarnate on the earth to kill you, all the three times, but you\nwill&nbsp; attain moksha in the end \u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He finished and hugged\nJaya and Vijaya, touched by their love and&nbsp;\ndevotion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was after this that\nJaya and Vijaya were first born as Hiranyaksha and Hiranyakasipu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first life they\nwere born as Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksha to Diti ( daughter of Daksha\nPrajapathi ) and sage Kashyapa.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu as Varaha the\nboar killed Hiranyaksha ( Jaya ). &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu took another\navatar as Narasimha the lion man to kill Hiranyakashipu ( Vijaya ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In their second life\nJaya and Vijaya were born as Ravana and his brother Kumbhakarna . This duo was\nkilled by Vishnu as avatar Lord Rama . &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In their third life\nJaya and Vijaya were born as Sishupala and Dantavakra. &nbsp;This duo was killed by Vishnu as avatar Lord\nKrishna.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h4kWZA1yB-k/UjvYTw17LvI/AAAAAAAAl_Y/B50V4OENO1c/s1600/valmikis_ramayana_comic_book_idk742.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h4kWZA1yB-k/UjvYTw17LvI/AAAAAAAAl_Y/B50V4OENO1c/s640/valmikis_ramayana_comic_book_idk742.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"478\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the classic Ramayana\ntext, Ravana is depicted negatively as a villain of the first order ,\nkidnapping the Rama's wife Sita, to claim vengeance on Rama and his brother\nLakshmana for having cut off the nose of his sister Surpanakha , and is finally\nkilled by Rama in a climactic battle. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">But\nyou must realize that this was a way to induce Vishnu ( Rama ) to kill Jaya ( Ravana ) , as per Vishnu\u2019s\nprophesy.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramayana epic has been\nmurdered by fake historians , including Christians and Buddhists from Sri Lanka\nwho think that Ravana is a Sinhala hero. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Sorry ye Sinhala Sri\nLankan historian fools</span></b>. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">King Ravana was a Hindu who spoke Sanskrit NOT Sinhalese , which did NOT exist. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lanka is a Sanskrit\nname-- and Sanskrit is 9000 years old. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was well versed\nwith Vedas written in 5000 BC, and was a great scholar, by Rama's admission to\nLakshman. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buddha is a recent phenomenon and Ravana was NOT a Buddhist . &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism is 5500 years\nolder than Judaism, 7000 years older than Christianity and 7600 years older\nthan Islam.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was an Indian\nBrahmin, whom Rama himself addressed as Maha brahmana. .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The war was fought in\nSri Lanka as Ravana had usurped his half brother Kubera\u2019s kingdom and palace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana\u2019s race from the\nmaternal side was that of Asura / Rakshasa and from his paternal side was of\nPrajapti (Lord Brahma's descendents). &nbsp;He\nwas an Agnihotri brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ramayana tells that\nRavana had close connections with region of the Yadus,&nbsp; which included Gujarat, parts of Maharashtra\nand Rajasthan up to Mathura south of Delhi.&nbsp;\nRavana was no commoner among the humans or asuras, and he knew the\nVedas. He was found of chanting the Sama Veda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was born to a\ngreat sage Vishrava (or Vesamuni), and his wife, the daitya princess Kaikesi. He was born in the Devagana, as his\ngrandfather, the sage Pulastya, was one of the ten Prajapatis or mind-born sons\nof Brahma and one of the Saptarishi (Seven Great Sages Rishi) in the first\nManvantara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana\u2019s brothers were\nVibhishana and Kumbhakarna. &nbsp;Kaikesi also\ngave birth to a beautiful daughter, \"Chandramukha\" (\"girl with\nmoon-like face\"), &nbsp;although later\nshe was dubbed the infamous Shoorpanakha ( \"winnow-like nails\") . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kaikesi's father,\nSumali (or Sumalaya), king of the Daityas, wished her to marry the most\npowerful being in the mortal world, so as to produce an exceptional heir. He\nrejected the kings of the world, as they were less powerful than him. Kaikesi\nsearched among the sages and finally chose Vishrava, the father of Kubera. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Father Vishrava noted\nthat Ravana was an exemplary scholar. &nbsp;Under\nVishrava's tutelage, Ravana mastered the Vedas, the holy books, and also the\narts and ways of Kshatriyas (warriors). Ravana was also an excellent veena\nplayer and the sign of his flag had a picture of veena on it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was married to\nMandodari, ( the beautiful daughter of the celestial architect Maya Danava who\nwrote the Surya Siddhanta ), &nbsp;Dhanyamalini,\nand a third wife. &nbsp;He had seven sons from\nhis three wives:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meghnaad (also known as\nIndrajit because he defeated Lord Indra), the most powerful son<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yohmoththa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atikaya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Akshayakumara<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Devantaka<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narantaka<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trishira<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mandodari\u2019s father was\na great Asura. &nbsp;The Mayan calendar was\nmade by Maya Danava, never mind what the fake western historians write. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mayan calendar ,\nwhich everybody knows about, is nothing but a Vedic calendar made by Maya\nDanava. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mayan calendar began with the Fifth Great Cycle in 3114 BC and ended\non 21 December 2012 AD. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Surya\nSiddhantam, </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya described how eclipses\nwere caused..&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya Danava went to\nPeru on his own Vimana which was a spacecraft. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He had designed several of these spacecrafts\nfor Kubera.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">MAYA , INCA , AZTEC\nCIVILIZATIONS DECODED VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya was an architect\nand a metallurgist par excellence-- he was a magician literally with palaces.\nHe was the architect of Tripura ( Atlantis ) and the Lanka palace of Kubera\nwhich was usurped by his half brother Ravana along with the Pushpaka Vimana.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the Ramayana war in 4300 BC, this vimana ( flying saucer with mercury\nplasma gyroscope vortex ) was returned back to its rightful owner Kubera by\nLord Rama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya Danava was a\ndescendant of Danu,&nbsp; one of Kasyapa\u2018s 13\nwives and a daughter of Dakhsa Prajapati.&nbsp;\nMaya\u2019s grandson ( Mandodari\u2019s son) Meghanada, defeated Indra and was\ncalled Indrajit.&nbsp; Maya\u2019s sons Dundhubi\nand Mayavi were killed by the Vanara, Vali.&nbsp;\nMaya\u2019s son-in-law Ravana was defeated by Lord Rama in the Ramayana\nwar.&nbsp; Maya is mentioned 23 times in the\nRamayana, and 61 times in the Mahabharata.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya Danava who build\nthe Indraprasta palace hall for Yuddhistira of Mahabharata was Ravana\u2019s father\nin law. . Bharadwaja\u2019s daughter married&nbsp;\nVisrava and her son was Kubera, the elder half-brother of Ravana.&nbsp; Ravana\u2019s grandfather Pulastya, told the story\nof the Big Bang to Bhishma at Gangadwar. (Padma Puranam).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since Sri Rama and\nRavana fought each other in Ramayana , this means Bhishma of Mahabharata was of\nthe same generation as Lord Rama.&nbsp;\nMaharishi Bhardwaja (grandfather of Ravana\u2019s half brother and Valmiki\u2019s\ndisciple). )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In greater detail\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana's parents were\nVishrava (son of Pulastya) and Kaikesi (daughter of Sumali and Thataka).\nKaikesi had two brothers Maricha and Subahu who would be Ravana's uncles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana had six brothers\nand two sisters:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kubera \u2013 the Guardian\nof Heavenly Wealth. &nbsp;He was an older\nhalf-brother of Ravana: they were born to the same father by different mothers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vibhishana \u2013 &nbsp;the younger brother and minister of Ravana who\nwould snitch Ravana\u2019s weak points to Rama thus weakening the King.&nbsp; Vibhishana advised Ravana to return the kidnapped\nSita ( Rama \u2018s wife ) and uphold Hindu Dharma. &nbsp;Ravana rejected this sane advice,and also\nbanished him from his kingdom. &nbsp;Vibhishana\nsought protection from Rama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kumbhakarna \u2013 &nbsp;One of the most jovial demons in Hindu history,\nwho is <b><span style=\"color: red;\">Vijaya</span></b> . When offered a boon by Brahma, he was tricked into asking for\neternal sleep! &nbsp;A horrified Ravana, out\nof brotherly love, persuaded Brahma to amend the boon. &nbsp;Brahma mitigated the power of the boon by\nmaking Kumbhakarna sleep for six months and being awake for rest six months of\na year. During the war with Rama, Kumbhakarna was untimely awakened from his\nsleep by all and sundr clanging bells near his ears. As soon as he got his\nbearings he tried to persuade his elder brother Ravana to open negotiations\nwith Rama and return Sita to him. Bound by a brother's duty, he fought on the\nside of Ravana and was killed in the battlefield.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surpanakha \u2013 The beautiful\nsister of Ravana. &nbsp;She was the ultimate root\nof the kidnapping of Sita.While Rama , Sita and Lakshmana were in the forest ,\nshe fell in love ( at first sight ) with Rama. Rama spurned her advances, telling\nher that he is married.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lakshmana cut of her nose . In Indian parlace cutting\nof the nose is just a \u201cfigure of speech\u201d. Surpanaka went back crying to Ravana and complained\nin full court .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Ravana refised to act, she took out her bangles and told\nhim to wear it , as he is NOT suitable to be a brother whose dharma is to\nprotect his sister. It was due to this woman that Ramayana war took place.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile Sri Ram being an avatar of Lord Vishnu , suddenly knew how things\nwere transpiring and he would soon kill his gatekeeper Jaya (Ravana) as per\nprophesy..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">To protect Sita he had an arrangement with Agnidev to take Sita to a\nsafe place and replace her by an ethereal image.&nbsp; The original Sita was never kidnapped and imprisoned\nby Ravana . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Nor did the &nbsp;agnipariska happen with the original Sita\nwhere Rama challenges her to prove her chastity , having been with Ravana for a\nlong time. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana did NOT even touch\nSita physically during kidnapping or captivity.. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana performed an\nintense penance (or tapasya) to Brahma (the Creator God).&nbsp; At last, Shiva, pleased with his astonishing austerity,\noffered him a boon. &nbsp;&nbsp;Ravana asked for\nimmortality, which Shiva refused to give, but gave him the celestial nectar of\nimmortality. &nbsp;The nectar of immortality,\nstored under his navel, dictated that he could not be vanquished for as long as\nit lasted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana also asked for\nabsolute invulnerability from and supremacy over gods, heavenly spirits, other\nrakshas, serpents, and wild beasts. &nbsp;Contemptuous\nof mortal men, he did not ask for protection from these. &nbsp;Shiva granted him these and great strength by\nway of knowledge of divine weapons and magic. Thus Ravana known as 'Dashaanan'\n, the man with ten heads worth of knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After winning these\nboons, Ravana sought out his grandfather, Sumali, and assumed leadership over\nhis huge army. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lanka was a beautiful city,\ncreated by the celestial architect Vishwakarma for Lord Shiva and acquired by\nKubera , the treasurer of the gods upon advice of his father Visravas. &nbsp;Kubera had generously shared all that he owned\nwith Ravana and the latter's siblings, who were Kubera's half-brothers and\nhalf-sister through his stepmother Kaikesi. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Vishrava, their father,\nadvised Kubera to give up his throne to his brother, as Ravana was now invincible.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishrava knew that both\nhis sons are at loggerheads and Ravan was more powerful. . Kubera had once chastised\nRavana for his greed, greatly angering him. &nbsp;Proceeding to the heavens, Ravana fought and\ndefeated the devas, singling out his brother for particular humiliation. &nbsp;By force he gained command over the devas,\ncelestials, and the serpent races. &nbsp;At\nthe time of the Ramayana, Ravana dominated all human and divine races..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although Ravana usurped\nLanka on advise of his father , he was a benevolent king. His people loved him\nas his rule was peaceful and Lanka was a land of plenty. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana went to meet\nShiva. &nbsp;Nandi the vehicle of Shiva,\nrefused to let Ravana in. &nbsp;Ravan got\nupset and started teasing Nandi. &nbsp;Nandi got\nannoyed and cursed Ravana that Lanka would be destroyed by a monkey. &nbsp;To demonstate to Nandi his great strength,\nRavana attempted to shake to lift and &nbsp;move Mount Kailash the mountain on a whim. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva, annoyed by Ravana's arrogance, pressed\nhis little toe on Kailash, pinning him firmly and painfully under it. &nbsp;Not to be outdone, Ravana plucked out the\nnerves from his hand used Kailash as a resonator and composed and sang &nbsp;stotras praising Lord Shiva. &nbsp;&nbsp;Finally\nShiva got pleased with his resilience and devotion , after hearing <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Shiva Tandav\nStotram</b></span> and &nbsp;released Ravana from his\nbondage . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/LTzef4HqjDI/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/LTzef4HqjDI&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/LTzef4HqjDI&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Shiva gave him the\ndivine sword Chandrahas shaped like the sliver crescent moon which resembles a\nsmile with a warning that the sword must NOT be used for unjust purposes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was during this\nincident that he acquired the name 'Ravana', meaning \"(He) Of the\nterrifying roar\", given to him by Shiva \u2013 the earth is said to have quaked\nat Ravana's anguished cry of pain when the mountain was pinned on him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%;\">See Hindu bashing is so lucrative. &nbsp;If they dare to do it against Islam they would have to hide like gophers in deep holes under the ground.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zIzjaBmsaWQ/Uj_DaKlsByI/AAAAAAAAmAg/xDUgeay2JqY/s1600/images.jpgnyfr.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zIzjaBmsaWQ/Uj_DaKlsByI/AAAAAAAAmAg/xDUgeay2JqY/s320/images.jpgnyfr.jpg\" height=\"308\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Nina Paley's\nanimated movie ending, you have Goddess Lakshmi reclining on the Sesh Naga with\nLord Vishnu massaging Her feet!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And this makes the\nwhite Christian and Jewish audience smirk in sarcasm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c Nina Paley is proving\nthat society rewards artists who refuse to sell their soul \u201c an Indian born\nHindu journalist Lavina Melwani writes.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now Sindhi woman\nMelvani&nbsp; will rake in the world journalism\nawards for being frank, free and OBJECTIVE.. &nbsp;The vulgar Italian waitress may even make her a Rajya Sabha member or a state governor.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was a cross of\nBrahmin and Rakshasa thus attaining a status of Brahmarakshasa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana also authored\nRavana Sanhita, a book on Hindu astrology. Ravana possessed a thorough\nknowledge of Ayurveda and political science. &nbsp;He is said to have possessed the nectar of\nimmortality, which was stored inside his belly, thanks to a celestial boon by\nBrahma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana\u2019s half brother Kubera\nholds a mace, a pomegranate or a money bag in his hand. He may also carry a\nsheaf of jewels or a mongoose with him. The pomegranate is about the Fibonacci\nseries and the golden mean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\">PERFECT SIX PACK &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mongoose symbolizes\nKubera's victory over N\u0101gas\u2014 the guardians of treasures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kubera also enjoys the titles \"king of\nthe whole world\". He had his own Vimana ( gyroscopic mercury ion powered\nspace craft ) . &nbsp;Before 7000 BC India\nruled the whole world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">VEDIC VIMANAS,\nGYROSCOPIC MERCURY VORTEX FLYING SAUCERS VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the epic\nMahabharata, Kubera is described as the son of Prajapati Pulastya and his wife\nIdavida and the brother of sage Vishrava. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kubera is known as the\n\"Lord of riches\" and the wealthiest Deva. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kubera is also a\nLoka-pala (\"world protector\") . &nbsp;Ravana\u2019s half brother Kubera, went around the\nworld on his vimana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>THE FLIGHT OF THE VEDIC\nVIMANA VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mahabharata says\nthat Brahma conferred upon Kubera the lordship of wealth, friendship with\nShiva, godhood, status as a world-protector.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>Below: Kubera holding a pomegranate.</b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D7qPPbfFDwQ/Uj_RyU8qAoI/AAAAAAAAmAw/1w6gUszdHng/s1600/kubera.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D7qPPbfFDwQ/Uj_RyU8qAoI/AAAAAAAAmAw/1w6gUszdHng/s640/kubera.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"436\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kubera himself is often\ndescribed as a Yaksha, but his father Visrava was a brahman and his maternal\ngrandfather Bharadwaja was a Brahman Rishi. &nbsp;Kubera had not a drop of Yaksha blood, he was\nmerely the ruler of the Yakshas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana had very little\nRakshasa Genes.&nbsp; &nbsp;Visrava blessed Kaikasi with 3 sons, Ravana, Kumbhakarna\nand Vibhishana and 1 daughter, Soorpanakha. &nbsp;Visrava was a brahman and the son of Pulastya\nand the grandson of Brahma. &nbsp;So Ravana\nand the other were half brahman, 1/32 rakshasa, 3/32 deva, 3/8 gandharva. &nbsp;So Ravana was more brahmana than rakshasa\ngenetically.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BY THE WAY, WHAT WOULD YOU DO IF SOMEONE CHOPPED OFF YOUR SISTER'S NOSE? &nbsp; WEAR BANGLES ?</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva and his wife Parvati often frequent Kubera's court, which was\nattended by semi-divine beings. Kubera is worshipped with Lakshmi, the goddess\nof wealth during Diwali.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are several\ntemples in India and around the world where Ravana is worshipped. &nbsp;Ravana is well known as the most revered\ndevotee of Lord Shiva. &nbsp;&nbsp;What type of devotee would pluck out his own\nnerves and play the veena to praise his lord?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Below : Shiva Tandav Stotram composed and sung by Ravana 6300 years ago .</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; made an\nimage of Parsvanath on the spot for her husband.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jains must know\nthat they are the second oldest religion on this planet. Never mind what the\nfake white historian has written.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a mandap &nbsp;named&nbsp; Ravan\nKi Chanwari&nbsp; where Ravana married\nMandodari at Mandor in Rajasthan.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Some Mudgal Gotra Brahmins\nof Jodhpur &nbsp;perform the shraddh (death rituals)\nof Ravana on Dashehra Day every year. &nbsp;This\ncan only be done by descendants and nobody fakes such solemn rituals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nRAVANA IS FROM THE YADU CLAN WHO MIGRATED FROM RIVER\nSARASWATI&nbsp; BANKS (&nbsp; AT THE SEA DELTA IN GUJARAT ) DOWN TO KERALA\nIN 6000 BC.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana is mentioned in\nour Ramayana classic of 4300 BC, &nbsp;as\nhaving his own Pushpak Vimana air craft, by which he abducted the Sita. &nbsp;Rama and Sita returned to Ayodhya by this same\nvimana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana\u2019s wife Mandodari\u2019s\nfather Maya Danava was a architect par excellence. &nbsp;He built the Maya Sabha at Indraprasta. &nbsp;&nbsp;The\nMahabharata war's ( 4000 BC ) root cause was this highly polished hall where\nDraupadi &nbsp;laughed loudly in sarcasm when\nKing Duryodhana fell in a pool.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya also built the\nTripura ( Atlantis for the Greeks ), which was destroyed by Lord Shiva. &nbsp;Maya ran away to Patala ( Peru ) after that .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana was a great astrologer\nand he has written a book on Astrology called \"Ravan Samhita\" .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Niti Shastra (political\nscience) is also written by Ravana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Ravana was about\nto die Rama sent his brother Lakshman to gain some wosdom,&nbsp; lest Ravana would die with it. &nbsp;&nbsp;Ravana shooed Lakshman away, &nbsp;unable to forget that this was the man who\nattacked his sister Shurpaneka\u2014and to add insult to injury Lakshman sat at\nRavana\u2019s head. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then Lord Rama sat at\nRavana\u2019s feet and they had a heart to heart. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana knew that Ram is Vishnu and Ram knew\nthat the dying man is his great devotee and old gatekeeper Jaya. &nbsp;Ravana is said to have given\nsome wisdom about time and ego management. (&nbsp;bad effects of greed, anger, procrastination etc\n)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even though Lord &nbsp;Rama forgave Ravana at the time of Ravana\u2019s\ndeath, &nbsp;the rest of India still does not\nand his effigy is still burnt every year during Dussera. &nbsp;We do NOT do that in Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
