line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>NOOR INAYAT KHAN, THE\nNEW MATA HARI RELOADED, BUSTING THE BIG LIE VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao\u2019s world famous <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>\u201cLittle\nRed book\u201d</b></span> was actually written by a Jew, Israel Epstein, Mao Tse Tung\u2019s\nminister of Finance and Rothschild\u2019s agent. &nbsp;&nbsp;Epstein\nwas trained in the art of Communist propaganda.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UxTMndw9dfo/UiZApRDt66I/AAAAAAAAlhs/9wALS2gVKt4/s1600/images.jpgfew.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UxTMndw9dfo/UiZApRDt66I/AAAAAAAAlhs/9wALS2gVKt4/s1600/images.jpgfew.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Little Red Book,\nthe name commonly known in the West for the pocket-size edition of Quotations\nfrom Chairman Mao Tse-Tung. It is one of the most printed books in history.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Admirers\nof Mao Zedong can frequently be found holding \u201cThe Little Red Book\u201d gripped\nwith their right hand waving it over their heads to show joy, or cries of\ncondemnation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qZyPaiR2h6Q/UiZAwAtwhfI/AAAAAAAAlh0/nRmM8radtcg/s1600/field_1492447i.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"260\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qZyPaiR2h6Q/UiZAwAtwhfI/AAAAAAAAlh0/nRmM8radtcg/s400/field_1492447i.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Above: &nbsp;Watch the peasants reading chaiLman Mao's little red book.&nbsp;</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\">chai</span><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">L</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\">man? --yes--Chinese cannot pronounce R, instead they say L. &nbsp; I had a Chinese agent friend, who loved to sing Hindi songs. &nbsp;His favourite was NOOO<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>L</b></span>IEEEEE &nbsp; AAJA<b><span style=\"color: red;\">L</span></b>E--&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Israel Epstein was a\nmost powerful man as he controlled the moolah as the minister of\nappropriations,in a practically cashless era.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1917, &nbsp;<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Jew Israel Epstein </b></span>came to China with his\nparents at the age of two and they settled in Tianjin in 1920. &nbsp;Israel Epstein when he grew up was a spy for the\nRussia\u2019s &nbsp;Red Communist secret police . Epstein's\ncover was journalism. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vxqHOxe_kF0/UiZA7Eid6xI/AAAAAAAAlh8/lPH3_YzFQnM/s1600/epstein3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vxqHOxe_kF0/UiZA7Eid6xI/AAAAAAAAlh8/lPH3_YzFQnM/s1600/epstein3.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He began to work in\njournalism at age 15, when he wrote for the Peking and Tientsin Times, an\nEnglish-language newspaper owned by Rothschild based in Tianjin. &nbsp;He was one of the few foreign-born non-Chinese\nto become a member of the Communist Party of China.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the autumn of 1938, he joined the China\nDefense League, which had been established by Soong Ching-ling, Sun Yat-sen's\nwidow, for the purpose of publicizing and enlisting international support for\nthe Chinese cause.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let me talk about\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">Mao\u2019s great long march</span></b> which converted him into a living legend.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iwozFgVOqBA/UiY6-K_zavI/AAAAAAAAlhM/DqjMeIWrROI/s1600/Mao.LongMarch.jpg.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"325\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iwozFgVOqBA/UiY6-K_zavI/AAAAAAAAlhM/DqjMeIWrROI/s400/Mao.LongMarch.jpg.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Long March (October\n1934-October 1935) was a military retreat undertaken by the Red Army of the\nCommunist Party of China, the forerunner of the People's Liberation Army, to\nevade the pursuit of the Chiang Kai Shek\u2019s Kuomintang (KMT or Chinese\nNationalist Party) army.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was NOT a single\nLong March, but a series of marches , as various Communist armies in the south\nescaped to the north and west.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Which idiot will walk continuously for 12500\nkilometers unless he is stupid?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The march began from from\nJiangxi province in October 1934. The Communists, under the command of Mao\nZedong, escaped in a circling retreat to the west and north, which reportedly\ntraversed some 12,500 kilometers &nbsp;over\n370 days ( sic!).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao's role was heavily\nexaggerated by Rothschild controlledmedia , and most events in the Long March are\npure unadulterated &nbsp;bull.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fblQrTDzq_0/UiY7GkoJmHI/AAAAAAAAlhU/dhZX8aoe62w/s1600/pic17.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"212\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fblQrTDzq_0/UiY7GkoJmHI/AAAAAAAAlhU/dhZX8aoe62w/s400/pic17.jpeg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As tom-tommed Chiang\nKai Shek\u2019s KMT did NOT give any hot pursuit, as he was blackmailed , with his\nson held captive in Russia , under Rothschild\u2019s control.. &nbsp;In reality Chiang Kai-shek allowed the\nCommunists to proceed without significant hindrance. They even &nbsp;provided the communists with maps and allowed\nthem to escape.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is false propaganda\nthat less than 7,000 were among the original 100,000 soldiers who had started\nthe \u201cgreatest strategic retreat in military history \u201c&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Xk_OGjse60g/UiY7P2qBDBI/AAAAAAAAlhc/_jbGTYYZQvs/s1600/gs714.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"280\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Xk_OGjse60g/UiY7P2qBDBI/AAAAAAAAlhc/_jbGTYYZQvs/s400/gs714.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe march was &nbsp;vital in helping the CCP to gain a positive\nreputation among the peasants due to the determination and dedication of the\nsurviving participants of the Long March\u201d &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao himself wrote in 1935. &nbsp;\u201c The Long March is a manifesto. It has\nproclaimed to the world that the Red Army is an army of heroes, while the\nimperialists and their running dogs, Chiang Kai-shek and his like, are\nimpotent. It has proclaimed their utter failure to encircle, pursue, obstruct\nand intercept us. The Long March is also a propaganda force. It has announced\nto some 200 million people in eleven provinces that the road of the Red Army is\ntheir only road to liberation.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been used as an\nexample to depict the nationalistic fighting spirit of the Chinese people and\nthe rallying call to communism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a speech given at\nStanford University, former US National Security Advisor Zbigniew Brzezinski\nmentioned a conversation that he once had with Deng Xiaoping. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He asked Deng about the astonishing and\nmind boggling great march. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deng who was part of\nthis long march with Mao, Zhu De, Lin Biao, Liu Shaoqi, Dong Biwu, Ye Jianying,\nLi Xiannian, Yang Shangkun and Zhou Enlai chuckled with a glint in&nbsp; his eye and said&nbsp;--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWell, that\u2019s the way it\u2019s presented in our\npropaganda. We needed that to express the fighting spirit of our forces. In\nfact, it was a very easy military operation. &nbsp;There wasn\u2019t really much to it. The other side\nwere just some troops of the warlord who were armed with old muskets and it\nreally wasn\u2019t that much of a feat, but we felt we had to dramatize it \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the establishment\nof the People's Republic of China in 1949, the Long March has been glorified as\nan example of the Communist Party's strength and resilience. The Long March\nsolidified Mao's status as the undisputed leader of the CPC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2003, two British\nresearchers, Ed Jocelyn and Andrew McEwen, retraced the route in 384 days, and\nin their 2006 book \"The Long March\" estimated the March actually\ncovered about 6,000 km .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jocelyn and McEwen conclude in their book that\n\"Mao and his followers twisted the tale of the Long March for their own\nends. Mao's role was mythologized to the point where ... it seemed he had\nsingle-handedly saved the Red Army and defeated Chiang Kai-shek\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CYW8QmJeRm0/UiY6zs4BSMI/AAAAAAAAlhE/LtU8yVzqzyI/s1600/long+march.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CYW8QmJeRm0/UiY6zs4BSMI/AAAAAAAAlhE/LtU8yVzqzyI/s400/long+march.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other researchers\ncontent that Mao cut across with Chiang Kai Shek\u2019s connivance and the march was\nactually just 35 % of the claim. Mao hardly walked . &nbsp;He was mostly on horse , or carried on a litter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>battle for Luding\nBridge</b></span> has been portrayed as thea most glorious and heroic moment in Chinese\nCommunist history. &nbsp;The official Rothschild\ncontrolled media account of the battle depicts exhausted and depleted Communist\nforces in a desperate situation, where they must fight across a bridge that is\nguarded by the numerically superior forces of Chiang Kai-shek and his warlord\nallies. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Communists send a small\nvolunteer force that braves a hail of gunfire to climb across the bridge on\nunderlying chains and assault the enemy positions on the other side, hence\nsecuring the bridgehead for the rest of the army to cross.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ei8llJpGcn4/UiY6dvPfP6I/AAAAAAAAlg0/GRwvlqeZhRs/s1600/Luding_bridge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ei8llJpGcn4/UiY6dvPfP6I/AAAAAAAAlg0/GRwvlqeZhRs/s400/Luding_bridge.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later many Western\njournalists and historians interviewed many eye witnesses . &nbsp;This was a bridge over the Dadu River in\nLuding County, Garz\u00ea Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Sichuan, China, located\nabout 80 kilometers west of the city of Ya'an. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2wP9NPGCUzo/UiY6q-zBk2I/AAAAAAAAlg8/4gza6r63K-8/s1600/painting-luding-museum.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bridge dates from the Qing Dynasty and is\nconsidered a historical landmark. &nbsp;In\n1935, during the Long March, soldiers of the Fourth Regiment of the Chinese\nWorkers and Peasants' Army \u201csecured\u201d &nbsp;the\nbridge as a river crossing vital to the Red Army.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They &nbsp;found that even this glorious battle was all\nbull.&nbsp; Much &nbsp;of the fighting was dramatized, by Communist\nleaders, for propaganda purposes. &nbsp;They\ntook a video recording of a female witness who stayed near the bridge &nbsp;who told that she saw no fighting and that the\nbridge was NOT guarded when the Communists arrived.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild has places\nmany &nbsp;German officers of Jewish origin in\nChiang Kai Shek\u2019s army and also his own mercenary Hessian soldiers .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao\nexactly knew what Chaing Kai Shek\u2019s next move would be. It is NOT the first time Rothschild funded both the sides in a conflict.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let us talk about<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>\nMao\u2019s great leap forward</b></span>.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As I said before, Mao\nwas catapulted to power by Rothschild by reading the FAKE long march m which made\nhim a living legend.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the civil war then\nresumed, &nbsp;Mao led the Red Army to victory\nas Chiang Kai Shek and his supporters fled to Taiwan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1949 Mao proclaimed\nthe foundation of the People's Republic of China, a one-party socialist state\ncontrolled by the Communist Party. After solidifying the reunification of China\nthrough his Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries, Mao enacted sweeping\nland reform, overthrowing the feudal landlords before seizing their large\nestates and dividing the land into people's communes.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oK1q-tAo5sc/UibmIRPub_I/AAAAAAAAllE/6EMW4_kvTNw/s1600/e15-653.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"221\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oK1q-tAo5sc/UibmIRPub_I/AAAAAAAAllE/6EMW4_kvTNw/s320/e15-653.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He proceeded to lead a\nnationwide political campaign known as the Great Leap Forward from 1958 through\nto 1961, designed to modernize and industrialize the country, however agrarian\nproblems worsened by his policies led to widespread famine. In 1966, he\ninitiated the Cultural Revolution, a program to weed out counter-revolutionary\nelements in Chinese society, which continued until his death.</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2M3Rg76aOKQ/Uibj7HxL4DI/AAAAAAAAlj0/PDamhyLM4hw/s1600/Propaganda-009-300x220.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2M3Rg76aOKQ/Uibj7HxL4DI/AAAAAAAAlj0/PDamhyLM4hw/s1600/Propaganda-009-300x220.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao\u2019s &nbsp;administration oversaw systematic human rights\nabuse.&nbsp; Maos was responsible for MORE\nTHAN 60 million deaths &nbsp;through\nstarvation, forced labor and executions, ranking his tenure as the top\nincidence of democide in human history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the Long March,\nMao's wife He Zizen had been injured from a shrapnel wound to the head, and so\ntraveled to Moscow for medical treatment; Mao proceeded to divorce her and\nmarry an actress, Jiang Qing The People's Republic of China was established on\nOctober 1, 1949.. From 1943 to 1976, Mao was the Chairman of the Communist\nParty of China.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tM1aJuH1TM8/UibkLWv4V3I/AAAAAAAAlkE/OPAUC0JcDCk/s1600/images.jpgkiugk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tM1aJuH1TM8/UibkLWv4V3I/AAAAAAAAlkE/OPAUC0JcDCk/s400/images.jpgkiugk.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During this period, Mao was called Chairman Mao. &nbsp;Mao\u2019s &nbsp;fourth wife, &nbsp;actress Jiang Qing, called \"Madame Mao\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Hx38ZN7bwQ8/UibkRksU1eI/AAAAAAAAlkM/VLXrAg9LDSE/s1600/4614631_orig.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Hx38ZN7bwQ8/UibkRksU1eI/AAAAAAAAlkM/VLXrAg9LDSE/s320/4614631_orig.gif\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Above: have hammer -- will hit</b></span></i> ( Buddha statue )</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao played a personal\nrole in organizing the mass repressions and established a system of execution\nquotas, which were often exceeded. &nbsp;He\ndefended these killings as necessary for the securing of power. Mao targeted the\ncapitalist Chinese to usurp their wealth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-voXJ0m_bFD0/UibkegjZwqI/AAAAAAAAlkU/4Rv_fypNkBM/s1600/e11-992.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-voXJ0m_bFD0/UibkegjZwqI/AAAAAAAAlkU/4Rv_fypNkBM/s400/e11-992.jpg\" width=\"275\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>Above: &nbsp;Have fruits- will collect !!</b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A climate of raw terror\ndeveloped as workers denounced their bosses, spouses turned on their spouses,\nand children informed on their parents; the victims often were humiliated at\nstruggle sessions, a method designed to intimidate and terrify people to the\nmaximum.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ax5QHgE8dAk/Uibklo3JwpI/AAAAAAAAlkc/8VvaYu6Opr0/s1600/551785_402611159794576_1818905299_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ax5QHgE8dAk/Uibklo3JwpI/AAAAAAAAlkc/8VvaYu6Opr0/s400/551785_402611159794576_1818905299_n.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao insisted that minor offenders be criticized and reformed or sent\nto labor camps, \"while the worst among them should be shot.\" These\ncampaigns took several hundred thousand additional lives, the vast majority via\nsuicide.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZxVufcn_Eco/UibmQSgWPDI/AAAAAAAAllM/9BRAqxmdXt0/s1600/D31A.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZxVufcn_Eco/UibmQSgWPDI/AAAAAAAAllM/9BRAqxmdXt0/s320/D31A.jpg\" width=\"238\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Shanghai, suicide by\njumping from tall buildings became so commonplace that residents avoided\nwalking on the pavement near skyscrapers for fear that suicides might land on\nthem. Some biographers have pointed out that driving those perceived as enemies\nto suicide was a common tactic during the Mao-era.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-unBksHOE1nY/Uibk2j1egfI/AAAAAAAAlks/HSd3gqhHTQ4/s1600/download.jpgkygum.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"290\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-unBksHOE1nY/Uibk2j1egfI/AAAAAAAAlks/HSd3gqhHTQ4/s400/download.jpgkygum.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Above: Communism or bust !</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At a secret meeting in\nthe Jinjiang Hotel in Shanghai dated March 25, 1959, Mao specifically ordered\nthe party to procure up to one third of all the grain, much more than had ever\nbeen the case. At the meeting he announced that \"When there is not enough\nto eat, people starve to death. It is better to let half of the people die so\nthat the other half can eat their fill.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jX-_Sr6xJiM/UibmXz9W7dI/AAAAAAAAllU/Gem_3FdZCqg/s1600/Great+Leap+Forward+poster.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jX-_Sr6xJiM/UibmXz9W7dI/AAAAAAAAllU/Gem_3FdZCqg/s400/Great+Leap+Forward+poster.jpg\" width=\"280\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Other violent campaigns followed in which\nparty leaders went from village to village in search of hidden food reserves,\nand not only grain, as Mao issued quotas for pigs, chickens, ducks and eggs.\nMany peasants accused of hiding food were tortured and beaten to death there\nwere at least 60 million premature deaths attributable to the Great Leap\nForward from 1958 to 1962. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Li Rui, Mao's\npersonal secretary, goes further and claims he was dismissive of the suffering\nand death caused by his policies: \"Mao's way of thinking and governing was\nterrifying. He put no value on human life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QAblc_rO1ws/UiblM8oCYAI/AAAAAAAAlk0/AZjBM-drcp8/s1600/images.jpgjbpyp.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"202\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QAblc_rO1ws/UiblM8oCYAI/AAAAAAAAlk0/AZjBM-drcp8/s400/images.jpgjbpyp.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The deaths of others meant nothing\nto him. Power was the means and the ends for Mao, and it had to be achieved at\nall costs. And the costs were terrible and the human costs unbelievable. Mao &nbsp;participated in the trade of opium &nbsp;in order to provide funding for his soldiers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like\nin the Russian Gulag, food in government run canteens was equated with the\namount of work done. Disabled and weak people got NO food and they starved to death.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-d5scFDnKZ_8/Uibl7brpQlI/AAAAAAAAlk8/Ec5j7mvw2GM/s1600/redgreen.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"276\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-d5scFDnKZ_8/Uibl7brpQlI/AAAAAAAAlk8/Ec5j7mvw2GM/s400/redgreen.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i>Above: Have food, will eat !!</i></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Private ownership of\nland ended and the peasants worked in large collective farms that were now\nordered to start up heavy industry operations, such as steel mills. Plants were\nbuilt in remote locations, despite the lack of technical experts, managers,\ntransportation or needed facilities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Industrialization failed but the main\nresult was a sharp unexpected decline in agricultural output, which led to mass\nfamine and millions of deaths.. \u2026 In short, ze Great Leap was a very expensive and\nmindless disaster.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3HuhSrHnGBE/UibmpyAQvoI/AAAAAAAAllc/nuAt4URMCcw/s1600/images.jpgk8ygoi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3HuhSrHnGBE/UibmpyAQvoI/AAAAAAAAllc/nuAt4URMCcw/s400/images.jpgk8ygoi.jpg\" width=\"278\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the death of &nbsp;Stalin , Khrushev who did NOT dance to the\ntune of the Jews anymore, came to power in Russia. &nbsp;So naturally Rothschild\u2019s man Mao was at\nloggerheads with Khrushev. After some time in power even Mao stopped dancing to\nRothschild\u2019s tunes. Mao was too powerful to be done away.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DvyFpXN0s5Q/UibnDdFXjVI/AAAAAAAAllk/Xb8_Med4Te4/s1600/images.jpgJYKJGUK.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"243\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DvyFpXN0s5Q/UibnDdFXjVI/AAAAAAAAllk/Xb8_Med4Te4/s400/images.jpgJYKJGUK.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jews waited till\nhis death to get Deng Xioping , the Chinese Perestrioka man in power. &nbsp;They tried to sideline Mao in between.&nbsp;Mao for a while was in the shadows, but he\nreturned to center stage and purged Deng and his allies in the \"cultural\nrevolution\" (1966-1969 ).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-C66T8Sf1LPs/UibnNV31aRI/AAAAAAAAlls/0SMGdXBTr2o/s1600/images.jpgjklvgjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"292\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-C66T8Sf1LPs/UibnNV31aRI/AAAAAAAAlls/0SMGdXBTr2o/s400/images.jpgjklvgjk.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Very soon Zionist Jews\nwould come in China in droves, to invest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The resulting one-upmanship\nand tension between Russian Khrushchev and Chinese Mao eroded the previous\npatron-client relationship between the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and\nthe CPC. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Cultural\nRevolution, the schools in China were closed and the young intellectuals living\nin cities were ordered to the countryside to be \"re-educated\" by the\npeasants, where they performed hard manual labor and other work. &nbsp;In 1969, Mao declared the Cultural Revolution\nto be over, although the official history of the People's Republic of China\nmarks the end of the Cultural Revolution in 1976 with Mao's death. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the last years of his life, Mao was faced\nwith declining health due to Parkinson's disease. &nbsp;Mao's last public appearance was on May 27, 1976,\nwhere he met the visiting Pakistani Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto during\nthe latter's one-day visit to Beijing. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mao was officially pronounced dead at 12:10 am\non September 9, 1976. &nbsp;September 9 was\nchosen as the day to let Mao officially die because it was seen as an easy day\nto remember, being the ninth day of the ninth month of the calendar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the mid-1990s, Mao\nZedong's picture began to appear on all new Renminbi currency from the People's\nRepublic of China.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-H7SpVYpm5M0/UibjXsRrAaI/AAAAAAAAljU/bIBkQds7TsE/s1600/1dollarsymbol.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"196\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-H7SpVYpm5M0/UibjXsRrAaI/AAAAAAAAljU/bIBkQds7TsE/s400/1dollarsymbol.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><i>Hey, Five stars became six.!!</i></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Acharya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M N Roy and Evelyn\nseparated in 1925 and she came back to USA where she settled and died in 1970. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why NOT? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She had NIL romantic\ninterest in MN Roy. &nbsp;This was strict Jewish\nhoneypot business. He must have felt like ZE cat's whiskers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roy tom tommed &nbsp;that a philosophical revolution must precede a\nsocial civil war and revolution.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From 1917 to&nbsp; 1925 &nbsp;Evelyn Trent &nbsp;collaborated with M.N.Roy in the physical and\nintellectual &nbsp;development of the\ninternational communist movement .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M.N.Roy at once started\nworking for the establishment of&nbsp; the\nCommunist Party in India. He supported subhas chandra bose to become the\nPresident of INC. &nbsp;His differences on war\npolicy with the Congress High Command made him and his followers resign from\nCongress and form the Radical Democratic Party.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Born on 21 March 1887,\nhis early name was Narendra Nath Bhattacharjee and was known in this name till\n1916.&nbsp; Though he adopted different names\nsuch as C Martin, Hari Sing, Mr White, D Garcia, Dr Mahmood, Mr Banerjee etc at\ndifferent times in conducting revolutionary activities, he was known as\nManabendra Nath Roy (MN Roy), the name he adopted at San Francisco to evade\narrest.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his young age itself he attended meetings addressed by Surendranath\nBanerjea Later on he was introduced to the Anushilan samiti of Aurobindo Ghosh.\nHe experimented in bomb making and practised shooting in the Sundarbans.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In July 1937, the first\nKerala unit of CPI was founded at a clandestine meeting in Calicut, my hometown.\n&nbsp;Five persons were present at the\nmeeting, P.Krishnapillai E.M.S.
