, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human lymph nodes are\nbean-shaped and range in size from a few millimeters to about 1\u20132 cm in their\nnormal state. Approximately 70% are superficial lymphatic capillaries\nlocated&nbsp; just under, the skin. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><i>Digression: If western women stop wearing tight under wired black bras they can avoid breast cancer.</i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The remaining 30%, which are known as deep\nlymphatic capillaries, surround most of the body\u2019s organs. The deep ones can be\nstimulated only by Yoga.&nbsp;</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like veins, the\nlymphatic vessels, which are known as lymphangions, have one-way valves to\nprevent any backward flow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like body inversions and head stand exercises,\ntwists offer your body new ways to remove toxins and flush important lymph\naround the entire torso. Yogic asanas to aid lymph flow includes neck rotation,\nshoulder shrugs, ankle pumps, leg slides, shoulder blade squeezes etc. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga diaphragmatic breathing and many yoga\npositions open up the chest cavity, while poses like shoulder stands, enlist\ngravity to help lymph fluid get where it is supposed to go. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since there is no pump,\nthe lymph movement relies on contraction of smooth muscle tissue lining the\nwalls of lymph vessels. &nbsp;Movement of skeletal\nmuscles is also important for driving lymph along the systems network of\nvessels to lymph nodes and from these to lymph ducts where the lymph tissue\njoins cardiovascular circulation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what the scientifically formulated\nYoga positions do.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human arteries are like a two-lane highway bringing\nnutrients, oxygen and fluid to the body part. The vein is a one-lane highway\ntaking away the used blood, and the lymphatic channels are the other one-lane\nhighway draining away the lymph fluid. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two lanes in together,\nbut two out lanes separate out. Blood is responsible for collecting and\ndistributing oxygen, nutrients and hormones to the entire body where lymph is\nresponsible for collecting and removing waste products left behind in the\ntissues.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plasma leaks out of the capillaries to surround and bathe the body\ntissues. This then drains into the lymph vessels. At the cellular level, the\nlymphatic system is a pathway through which fluid flows from the intercellular\nspaces into the blood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph nodes are the filters along the lymphatic\nsystem.&nbsp; Their job is to filter out and\ntrap bacteria, viruses, cancer cells, and other unwanted substances, and to\nmake sure they are safely eliminated from the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6000 years ago, Ayurveda\nand Yoga&nbsp; realized that many lymph nodes\nare situated near the region around the joints. Humans have approximately\n500-700 lymph nodes distributed throughout the body, with clusters found in the\nunderarms, groin, neck, chest, and abdomen. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All lymph vessels lead\nto lymph nodes. Lymph nodes can be as small as the head of a pin, or as big as\nan olive . Half of the lymph nodes in the body, are&nbsp; located in the abdomen, and many are in the\nneck.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The movements of the limbs help to act as a pump to move the lymph\nthrough the system. They are located in clusters around the knee, groin,\nelbows, shoulders and neck. Lymph nodes are also found in the central abdominal\nand chest area to assist with lymph drainage around the vital organs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Yoga movement\ntake this into account. This is why Yoga must not be self inflicted.&nbsp; Because the lymph doesn't have a heart to\npump it so good circulation of the lymphatic system depends on getting proper\nstretching exercise and yogic inverted postures which use gravity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; This vinyasa\n'flow' is a variant of Surya namaskar.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The breathing style used in Ashtanga\nVinyasa Yoga is Ujjayi which is a relaxed diaphragmatic style of breathing,\ncharacterized by an ocean sound which resonates in the practitioner's throat. The\nopening sequence begins with 10 Sun Salutations and then several standing\nasanas. Practice always ends with savasana, where you lie down relaxed and\nthink of the calm ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranayama\u2014inhale and\nexhale with awareness\u2014 long exhales with the sound of mmmm. &nbsp;Humming boosts level of nitric oxide\u2014this in\nturn ups the oxygen intake by 98%, the biggest secret . &nbsp;Ordinary breath is a mere 4%.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is amazing Nitric oxide was discovered by\nIndian yogis 11000 years ago.&nbsp; For\nre-inventing this a Nobel prize was given 2 decades ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is\nnecessary for-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>1. Destruction of\nviruses, parasitic organisms, and malignant cells in the airways and lungs by\ninactivating their respiratory chain enzymes.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>2. Regulation of\nbinding - release of O2 to hemoglobin.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>3. Vasodilation of\narteries and arterioles (regulation of blood flow or perfusion of tissues).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>4. Inhibitory effects\nof inflammation in blood vessels.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>5. Hormonal effects.\nNitric oxide influences secretion of hormones from several glands (adrenaline,\npancreatic enzymes, and gonadotropin-releasing hormone)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>6. Neurotransmission.\nMemory, sleeping, learning, feeling pain, and many other processes are possible\nonly with NO present (for transmission of neuronal signals).</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When there is lack of\noxygen in your blood , you living to a small percentage of your potential.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashtanga series has its\n&nbsp;origin in an ancient text called the\nYoga Korunta, compiled by Vamana Maharirishi . T Krishnamacharya received from\nhis Guru Rama Mohan Brahmachari at Mount Kailash.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pattabhi Jois got this wisdom\nfrom his master T Krishnamachari.&nbsp; In\n1927, at the age of 12, Pattabhi Jois attended a Yoga demonstration at the\nJubilee Hall &nbsp;in Hassan by T.\nKrishnamacharya and became his student the very next day\u2014there was no looking\nback after this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Maharaja of\nMysore, Krishna Rajendra Wodeyar, had become seriously ill ,T Krishnamacharya\nhad healed him, through yoga, where British doctors failed. &nbsp;The Maharaja became Krisnamacharya's patron\nand established a Yoga shala for him. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How many of you know that the Mysore palace is\nvisited more than the Taj Mahal?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-byDyVoJPOOc/UhOrlNiMaQI/AAAAAAAAlUE/KXgZLxRqlpU/s1600/mysore-mysore-palace-picture-gallery.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">K. Pattabhi Jois taught\nup until he passed away on May 18, 2009, and he just followed what he learned\nfrom his guru Sri T. Krishnamacharya.&nbsp;\nBoth Jois and Iyengar were students in the same class of Krishnamacharya\nat Mysore .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What does Ashtanga Yoga\ndo for you?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It improves the feel\ngood factor giving you a natural high, reduces stress , increases vitality, &nbsp;improves strength and flexibility , improves\nimmune system function, improves blood and lymph circulation, eliminates body\ntoxins, strengthens the cardiovascular system , improves digestion, metabolism\nand hormone production, gets rid of &nbsp;depression and anxiety , reduces mind chatter,\n&nbsp;improves &nbsp;concentration, builds patience , gets rid of\nobesity and sloth, balances body- mind- spirit, and keeps diseases away .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashtanga Yoga stimulates the <b><span style=\"color: red;\">Vagus nerve</span></b> and the Amygdala to\ncure many disorders conveniently branded as genetic disorders by modern\nmedicine\u2014just because they do NOT have a clue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WdcvTmNFF7U/UhPG7advATI/AAAAAAAAlU0/avYj2OsS9fY/s1600/vagus_nerve.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WdcvTmNFF7U/UhPG7advATI/AAAAAAAAlU0/avYj2OsS9fY/s400/vagus_nerve.jpg\" width=\"347\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what is this vagus nerve?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">T Krishmacharya\nstimulated his Vagus nerve and Amygdala to stop his heart beat and control involuntary\nmuscles.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve stimulation\n(VNS) therapy using a pacemaker-like device implanted in the chest , to control\nseizures in epilepsy patients and has recently been approved for treating\ndrug-resistant cases of clinical depression.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XEj8uVnzozc/UhPJuz3SWLI/AAAAAAAAlVA/U_7U7xlIiUI/s1600/vagal-nerve.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"274\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XEj8uVnzozc/UhPJuz3SWLI/AAAAAAAAlVA/U_7U7xlIiUI/s320/vagal-nerve.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">They should be able to make a\nnon-invasive VNS device that stimulates an afferent branch of the vagus nerve\nsoon.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/sZunT34Wl2o/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/sZunT34Wl2o&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/sZunT34Wl2o&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drugs like Atropine &nbsp;inhibit the action of the vagus nerve on the\nheart. </span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During\nanaesthesia and surgery, Atropine is used to help keep the heart beat normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YKe2PvuFlUk/UhPKGEs2GQI/AAAAAAAAlVQ/38bXmk5N2Tw/s1600/parasympathetic-division.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"326\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YKe2PvuFlUk/UhPKGEs2GQI/AAAAAAAAlVQ/38bXmk5N2Tw/s400/parasympathetic-division.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your body's levels of\nstress hormones are regulated by the autonomic nervous system (ANS) . The ANS\nhas two components that balance each other, the sympathetic nervous system\n(SNS) and the parasympathetic nervous system (PNS).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SNS turns up your\nnervous system. It helps us handle what we perceive to be emergencies and is in\ncharge of the flight-or-fight response.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The PNS turns down the\nnervous system and helps us to be calm. It promotes relaxation, rest, sleep,\nand drowsiness by slowing our heart rate, slowing our breathing, constricts the\npupils of our eyes, increases the production of saliva in our mouth, and so\nforth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve is the\nlongest nerve in the human body.&nbsp; It\nextends from within the brain on a winding road throughout the body down\nthrough the intestine.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve\nalso, just so happens, to be the only nerve in the body that is present through\neach one of the 7 Chakras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve is a\nmixed cranial nerve containing approximately 85% sensory fibers &nbsp;communicating the ste of the viscera to the\nbrain. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0-XS0-3FAsg/UhPK2KbTfWI/AAAAAAAAlVc/wbJuN-zlTas/s1600/F1.large.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0-XS0-3FAsg/UhPK2KbTfWI/AAAAAAAAlVc/wbJuN-zlTas/s400/F1.large.jpg\" width=\"337\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve supplies motor parasympathetic fibers to all the\norgans except the suprarenal (adrenal) glands, from the neck down to the second\nsegment of the transverse colon.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus also controls a few skeletal muscles.\nBesides output to the various organs in the body, the vagus nerve conveys\nsensory information about the state of the body's organs to the central nervous\nsystem.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve regulates\nthe chemical levels in the digestive system so that the intestines can process\nfood and keep track of what types of nutrients are being gained from the food\nthat is taken in.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">keeps the digestive tract in working order,\ncontracting the muscles of the stomach and intestines to help process food, and\nsending back information about what is being digested and what the body is\ngetting out of it.</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-szSdwSIcvbw/UhPL52qB3gI/AAAAAAAAlVk/_N7mk5LS_Ow/s1600/sym_para_NS.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-szSdwSIcvbw/UhPL52qB3gI/AAAAAAAAlVk/_N7mk5LS_Ow/s640/sym_para_NS.jpg\" width=\"475\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stems cells are\ndirectly connected to the vagus nerve.&nbsp;\nActivating the vagus nerve can stimulate stem cells to produce new cells\nand repair and rebuild your own organs. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By activating the vagus\nnerve, you can control your immune cells, reduce inflammation, and even prevent\ndisease and aging!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C5gR27GWd6Y/UhRP3gHveuI/AAAAAAAAlV8/FfaEzi7rmy0/s1600/250px-Gray791.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; This condition leads to\nnausea, heartburn, stomach pains, spasms in the stomach and weight loss due to\nthe digestive system having too little of the chemicals it needs to break down\nfood. An underactive vagus nerve can also lead to a dropping heart rate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The\nEnteric Nervous System is &nbsp;involved\npredominantly with food digestion, waste elimination and sending full/hungry\nsignals to the brain.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">90% of the nerve fibers\nof the ENS run one way, from the stomach area, through the vagus nerve and up\ninto the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Furthermore, more than 95%\nof the body\u2019s serotonin is produced in the gut, not in the brain as modern\nmedicine assumes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ENS has a greater\nrole than managing our gastrointestinal needs. &nbsp;More than 95% of our thoughts occur in our\nsubconscious minds , the right brain lobe for a right hander. The Enteric\nNervous System is &nbsp;the organ of the\nsubconscious mind.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\">THE RAPE OF THE\nSUBCONSCIOUS MIND VADAKAYIL</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The parasympathetic\nsystem is pretty automatic and not within that \"conscious\" control. Sometimes\nyou need to step back and \"allow\" intelligent conscious morphogenetic\nenergy to flow the way it normally would if you didn't put up a fight or\nflight.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human Beings have an\nAutonomic Nervous System (ANS) that is the body\u2019s automatic regulatory system\nof nerves and controls that do all the background tasks that keep the body\noperating. The ANS is comprised of three separate subsystems, the\nParasympathetic Nervous System (PNS), the Sympathetic Nervous System (SNS) and\nthe Enteric Nervous System (ENS).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Parasympathetic Nervous System is\nresponsible for many of our resting functions such as lowering heart rate,\nincreasing digestive &amp; gland activity and sexual arousal, the Sympathetic\nNervous System is mainly associated with modulation of hormones and\nneurotransmitters relating to \u201cflight or fight\u201d responses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When things in our life\nbecome \u2018second nature\u2019, like driving, typing etc they are effectively processed\nthrough our ENS rather than our CNS. The cerebrospinal system is the organ of\nthe conscious mind and is the channel through which we receive conscious\nperception from the physical senses, and exercise control over the movements of\nthe body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the cerebrospinal or central nervous system (CNS)&nbsp; has the brain as its control center, the ENS\nhas a ganglionic mass in the belly known as the Solar Plexus, often referred to\nas our second brain, as its central processing unit and it is in this\ncoprocessor that most of our everyday tasks get executed from.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve is the\nmost important element of the parasympathetic nervous system (the one that\ncalms you down by controlling your relaxation response).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nan athlete is said to be \u2018in the zone\u2019 and performing at near perfect levels,\nit is because they are practically and literally almost unconscious and\nfunctioning entirely through their ENS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">IN THE FLOW &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">IN THE ZONE VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve is\nresponsible for speech, swallowing, keeping the larynx open for breathing,\nslowing heart rate, monitoring and initiating digestive processes, and modulating\ninflammation, among other actions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus rerve arises\nfrom the medulla in the brain and passes through the skull down within the\nchest cavity where it branches off in multiple directions to innervate organs\nand muscles. 85% of the nerve fibers are devoted to sending information from\nthe organs/gut back to the brain.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve also relays information to\nthe brain from what is known as the Enteric Nervous System (ENS). &nbsp;The ENS is our \"second brain\"\ncontrolling the digestive process; it is made up of over 500 million neurons\nthat surround the digestive tract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said before , it is called a second\nbrain because it can function independently from the brain if the Vagus nerve\nis severed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different postures that\nare adopted during Ashtanga yoga exercise helps in releasing pressure from the\ndelicate nerve fibers. Vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) activates\nanti-inflammatory pathways that work in the digestive tract. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VNS to be a possible treatment for chronic\ndepression in people that didn't respond to any other treatments . Defects in\nthe normal functioning of Vagus nerve may impair the normal control mechanisms\nthat modulate the gastric acid secretion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessive secretion of peptic acid\ncan lead to ulceration, dyspepsia and gastro-esophageal reflux disease. The\nunder-activity of vagus nerve may interfere with the blood supply of stomach\nafter ingestion of food that leads to improper digestion. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By deep breathing, you activate the vagus\nnerve and bring balance between your parasympathetic and sympathetic nervous\nsystem rn, nausea and weight loss. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">FATHERS OF SURGERY AND\nMEDICINE 4200 BC &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VNS, statistic have\nproved that most people with severe migraine were able to get relief..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve is connected\nto receptor networks for oxytocin, a neurotransmitter involved in trust and\nmaternal bonding. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stimulating\nthat vagus nerve is not only good for you , it\u2019s good for planet earth.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve is a nerve &nbsp;comes from the brain and controls\nthe parasympathetic nervous system, which controls your relaxation response. And\nthis nervous system uses the neurotransmitter, acetylcholine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If your brain\ncannot communicate with your diaphragm via the release of acetylcholine from\nthe vagus nerve, then you will stop breathing and die.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acetylcholine is\nresponsible for learning and memory.&nbsp; It\nis also calming and relaxing, which is used by vagus nerve to send messages of\npeace and relaxation throughout your body.&nbsp;\nAcetylcholine reduces &nbsp;inflammation in the body.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VNS sends acetylcholine throughout your\nbody, not only relaxing you but also turning down the fires of inflammation\nwhich is related to the negative effects from stress. This is why Ashtanga Yoga\nreduces stress.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">And what is\nacetylcholine?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">German Jew <b>Otto Loewi (\nbelow )</b> the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1936, because he has\naccess to ancient Ayurveda texts on the good effects of Yoga and how the\nneurotransmitters reduce the heart beat \u2014 yes the infamous Rothschild\nconnection again.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">is linked to a lack of acetylcholine.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two amygdale sit on\nthe horn-like tips of the hippocampus. They work with our sympathetic nervous\nsystem to put the body in a state of \u201cfight-or-flight\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2k5Mv0ln3Pg/UhWfHr3k19I/AAAAAAAAlYA/27P0fo7G5i8/s1600/images.jpghgfjh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2k5Mv0ln3Pg/UhWfHr3k19I/AAAAAAAAlYA/27P0fo7G5i8/s400/images.jpghgfjh.jpg\" width=\"344\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala has an\nimportant role in memory.&nbsp; It reminds us,\nfor better or worse, of past situations. Since it is so emotional, the amygdala\nis responsible for those persistent thoughts and extra mental baggage we wish\nwe would forget. &nbsp;It nags us with\nrecollections of painful or shocking events. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6siWj7OwGvw/UhWeyH1715I/AAAAAAAAlX4/9pro-J7mx_M/s1600/download.jpgjytitew.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"275\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6siWj7OwGvw/UhWeyH1715I/AAAAAAAAlX4/9pro-J7mx_M/s400/download.jpgjytitew.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So when a woman jumps out of her skin with a\nterrible shriek at the sight of a rat \u2013 its is just an example of her amygdala\nin action!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stimulating the\namygdala by meditation and Pranayama &nbsp;can\nhelp you enter a psychological state of flow. Activating the amygdala in a\npositive way stimulates higher order mental processes. This can improve\ncreativity and intelligence while elevating positive emotion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">There are also\nlinks ( which can be modified ) between <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">homosexuality </span>and the connectivity of\nthe amygdala to the rest of the brain.&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Homosexuality depends\non hormonal factors operating during fetal life and NOT genetics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">No baby is\nborn a homosexual.&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the amygdala is almost fully developed at birth, the\nprefrontal cortex does not mature until early adulthood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kx8dFfaxD6E/UhXqclLzSTI/AAAAAAAAlYQ/d3uudlVd2ww/s1600/download.jpggvjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kx8dFfaxD6E/UhXqclLzSTI/AAAAAAAAlYQ/d3uudlVd2ww/s400/download.jpggvjk.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Damage to the amygdala can thus result\nin behavioral deficits such as autism, post traumatic stress syndrome, child\nabuse, alcoholism, etc. The amygdala is not only sensitive to physical hurt but\nalso to emotional hurt.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So it is involved in both the basic emotions such as\npain, pleasure, fear, disgust, surprise, and anger but also in social emotions,\nviz., shame, guilt, love, embarrassment, envy, jealousy, and pride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this state you can\neasily overcome problems and disregard distractions. Being in flow on\nauto-pilot results in single-minded focus and joy that comes from losing\nyourself in productive activity. Trivial\nissues don't slow you down when you are actively engaged and living creatively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala plays a\ncentral role in generating fear in response to external threats. The amygdala\nreceives sensory information from two separate pathways: a short route and a\nlong route. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like all sensory\ninformation, the message is first routed to the thalamus. Then information is\nsent directly to the amygdala (short route), which produces a fast reaction to\nthe situation. Other information travels from the thalamus through the cortex\n(visual, auditory, prefrontal, etc.) and then to the amygdala (long route). The\ncortex evaluates the situation, assigns it a meaning, and if the meaning is threatening,\nthen the amygdala is informed and produces the appropriate response.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gay women and gay men\nare more likely to be left-handed.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right amygdala is\nalso linked with taking action as well as being linked to negative emotions, which\nmay help explain why males tend to respond to emotionally stressful stimuli\nphysically. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left amygdala allows for\nthe recall of details, but it also results in more thought rather than action\nin response to emotionally stressful stimuli, which may explain the lack of\nphysical response in women. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet women\nwant to join the army commando unit , right?</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala memory is\nconsolidated during the REM sleep. &nbsp;EEG\nreflects neuronal activities only in the cerebral cortex, not the deep brain\nareas such as the hippocampus and amygdala .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amygdala is the\nemotion and threat recognition centre of the brain. During REM, the sleep state\nimmediately adjacent to an episode of sleep paralysis, the amygdala is very\nactive. &nbsp;Bursts of activity from the\nbrainstem pass through the thalamus, which passes activity onto the amygdala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna know what is REM?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">THE DREAMER AND REM\nSLEEP, THE WITNESS AND TURIYA &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-N3iDLg0UbYg/UhX2LQ_HzKI/AAAAAAAAlYg/ypstfjLx4XY/s1600/download.jpgreb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-N3iDLg0UbYg/UhX2LQ_HzKI/AAAAAAAAlYg/ypstfjLx4XY/s400/download.jpgreb.jpg\" width=\"372\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gamma-Amino Butyric\nacid (GABA) is an amino acid which acts as a neurotransmitter in the central\nnervous system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Oq_IuYuu2qI/UhX2UpA7whI/AAAAAAAAlYw/49KNJmHxthc/s1600/images.jpgjfdj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Oq_IuYuu2qI/UhX2UpA7whI/AAAAAAAAlYw/49KNJmHxthc/s1600/images.jpgjfdj.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astanga Yoga increases &nbsp;our GABA levels , which reduces stress. &nbsp;GABA levels and mood are positively affected\nby yoga practice. Low levels of GABA are linked to depression and anxiety. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fVynWyzuBws/UhX2QeMpoZI/AAAAAAAAlYo/p_pv-GxJkpw/s1600/images.jpghgjbu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"243\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fVynWyzuBws/UhX2QeMpoZI/AAAAAAAAlYo/p_pv-GxJkpw/s400/images.jpghgjbu.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA is the major neurotransmitters\nin the central nervous system, and especially in the cerebral cortex, which is\nwhere thinking occurs and sensations are interpreted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vpjgLHf4PII/UhX2Y85uSyI/AAAAAAAAlY4/uIz4RY8BmgM/s1600/images.jpghjtrww.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"204\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vpjgLHf4PII/UhX2Y85uSyI/AAAAAAAAlY4/uIz4RY8BmgM/s320/images.jpghjtrww.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GABA is made in brain\ncells from glutamate, and functions as an inhibitory neurotransmitter \u2013 meaning\nthat it blocks nerve impulses. &nbsp;Glutamate\nacts as an excitatory neurotransmitter and when bound to adjacent cells\nencourages them to \u201cfire\u201d and send a nerve impulse. GABA does the opposite and\ntells the adjoining cells not to \u201cfire\u201d, not to send an impulse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without GABA, nerve\ncells fire too often and too easily. &nbsp;Anxiety\ndisorders such as panic attacks, seizure disorders, and numerous other\nconditions including addiction, headaches, Parkinson's syndrome, and cognitive\nimpairment are all related to low GABA activity. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The less GABA, the more nerve transmissions\noccur. Depressed and bipolar patients to have lower levels of GABA in their\nblood plasma. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;So -- &nbsp;anybody for Ashtanga Yoga?</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me share &nbsp;a secret , on how to stimulate the amygdala. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\">This </span><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">BOKOMA</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"> instrument\nwas used in ancient Vedic times to find out what type of Ayurvedic Shirodhara\nyou need. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also \u201creleases\u201d your locked\nup mind. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gcIW0tQGsB4/UiqrXlQjGoI/AAAAAAAAlrE/QHFEr00y-nE/s1600/htrej.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
